objectives.en: The course aims to study, using the tools of industrial economics, the optimal regulatory policies in the context of the European Union single market.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on kasutades struktuuriökonoomika vahendeid uurida optimaalset regulatiivset ja konkurentsipoliitikat Euroopa Liidu ühisturu kontekstis.

learning_outcomes.en: After taking the course, students will be able to
* use economic theory for the analysis of the regulatory pro-competitive policies;
learning_outcomes.et: * kasutada majandusteoreetilisi lähenemise regulatiivsete ja konkurentsi soodustavate poliitikate analüüsimiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: * engage in discussions about better and innovative ways of the delivery of public services.
learning_outcomes.et: * osaleda diskussioonides avalike teenuste parematest ja uudsetest pakkumise viisidest.

grade_evaluation.et: There will be a written examination. The exam will last 60 minutes. Students taking the exam will be required to reply to two open questions concerning each part of the course. The two questions will have an equal weight in the determination of the final mark. No material will be allowed for consultation during the exam.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: Articles and book chapters are indicated in the syllabus and made available in the library. Instructors may decide to provide students with slides.
resources.recommended_materials: Articles and book chapters distributed in the class.
